lies in the city centre on the western bank of Khabir river. It served as the governor's house in the reign of the Badinan Emirate and was extended by prince Ali Khan. It was built on the ruins of an older castle. Today, only the tower remains.
, situated in Zakho cemetery, is hexagonal in shape, with six windows and an entrance gate.
